alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Hart; Larue (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 10:24PM EST until further notice by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EST/1245 AM CST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hardin and Larue. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hart. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EST /1245 AM CST/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM EST /922 PM CST/, trained weather spotters reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Hodgenville, New Haven, Upton, Sonora, Tanner, Mathers Mill, Maxine, Tonieville and Nolin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
